If a small group of organisms (a small population) is separated from the main population from which it originates (e.g. if they migrate over a mountain range or across a river, so that they cannot easily return), they will often find themselves in a different environment than before.

This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so that the new population needs different characteristics or adaptations in order to be a strong competitor, as opposed to what it needed before.
The original population has not changed at all. It still needs the same adaptations as before.
Over time, the new population begins to adapt to its new environment, and then it looks less and less like the other population.
After thousands or even millions of years two populations will look so different that they can no longer be classified as the same species.
We call this process speciation, which simply means the emergence of new species. Speciation is an inevitable consequence and a very important part of evolution.

Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from the technological push or the technological imperative to the strict sense that human destiny is determined by a logic that is linked to scientific laws and its manifestation in technology.

Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general views. On the one hand, that the development of technology follows a path that is largely outside of cultural or political influence, and on the other hand, that technology has effects on societies that are more inherent than socially determined.
It can be said that the automobile is indispensable for the development of roads.
However, a nationwide road network for only a small number of cars is not economically viable. Therefore, new production methods are being developed to reduce the cost of car ownership.

The widespread ownership of automobiles also leads to a higher number of accidents on the roads, which in turn leads to the invention of new technologies in the field of medicine to repair damaged bodies.

Tax-free shopping is the possibility of buying goods that are exempt from taxes and consumption taxes at certain locations.
Travelers whose destination country has a high tax rate can sometimes save a considerable amount of money, particularly on alcoholic beverages and tobacco.

If you are not used to driving on country roads, be careful: steep slopes, narrow lanes and sharp bends prevail here.

German baked goods are rather tasty. In Bavaria they are rather nutritious and varied, as are those of the southern neighbour Austria.
Fruit cakes are widely available, with apples being sold all year round and cherries and plums being used in the summer.

A curry can be either dry or wet depending on the amount of liquid.
In the interior of northern India and Pakistan, yogurt is used in curries; in southern India and some other coastal regions of the subcontinent, coconut milk is used.
With a selection of 17,000 islands, Indonesian cuisine is an overarching term that encompasses a wide variety of regional cuisines that can be found throughout the country.
When the term is used without further attributes, it generally refers to the food that originated in the central and eastern parts of the main island of Java.

The Javanese cuisine, which is now widespread throughout the island group, offers a wide variety of simply spiced dishes. The Javanese prefer to use peanuts, chilis, sugar (especially Javanese coconut sugar) and a variety of aromatic spices as flavouring.
Spurs are aids for the feet of riders, which hang down on both sides of the saddle.
They give the rider more stability, but there are safety concerns because the rider's feet might get caught in them.
If a rider falls off a horse and gets caught by the stirrup, he can be dragged along if the horse runs on. To minimize this risk, a number of safety measures can be taken.
First of all, most riders wear riding boots with a heel and a flat, rather narrow sole.
In addition, some saddles, in particular English saddles, have safety buckles that allow a stirrup leather to fall as soon as it is pulled backwards by a falling rider.
The Cochamó Valley – Chile's most important climbing destination, known as the Yosemite National Park of South America, with many large granite walls and cliffs.

Downhill sports such as skiing and snowboarding are popular sports in which you attach skis or a snowboard to your feet and slide down a snow-covered slope.
Skiing is a popular holiday activity with many enthusiasts, sometimes referred to as „ski bunnies“, who plan their entire holiday around skiing at a particular location.
The idea of skiing is very old – cave paintings with depictions of skiers date back to 5000 BC!
The origins of skiing as a sport go back at least to the 17th century, and in 1861 the first recreational ski club in Australia was opened by Norwegians.
Hiking with a backpack: This activity is also called ski touring or ski hiking.
It resembles alpine touring skiing or mountaineering, but does not necessarily include it, as the latter involves steep terrain and requires more robust ski equipment and boots.
Treat the ski run like a comparable hiking trail.
With good conditions, you can cover longer distances than on a hike--but only very rarely will you be able to match the speed of cross-country skiing on well-groomed trails without a heavy backpack.

Europe is a relatively small continent, but it has many independent countries. Normally, you would have to apply for several visas and go through several passport checks if you wanted to travel through several countries.
The Schengen area functions in this respect somewhat like a country.
As long as you stay in this zone, you can normally cross the border without having to go through passport control again.
You do not have to apply for a visa for each of the Schengen member states, which saves time, money and bureaucracy.
There is no universally accepted definition of what constitutes antiques. Some tax authorities define antiques as objects more than 100 years old.
The definition points to geographical differences, where the age limit is lower in places like North America than in Europe.
Handmade products could be described as "antique" even though they are younger than similar products from mass production.

Storm is the collective term for any dangerous weather phenomenon with the potential to cause damage, severe social disruption or the loss of human life.
Thunderstorms can occur anywhere in the world and there are different types of them that depend on the geography, topography, and atmospheric conditions.
Strong winds, hail, excessive rainfall and forest fires are forms and effects of unsettled weather, as are thunderstorms, tornadoes, water spouts and whirlwinds.
Regional and seasonal weather phenomena include blizzards, snowstorms, ice storms and dust storms.
Travellers are warned to keep an eye on any kind of weather that affects their area, as this can affect all their travel plans.

Rip currents are the returning current of broken waves at the beach, often at reefs or similar.
Due to the underwater topography, the flow is concentrated in a few deeper areas, and a fast current can form in deeper water.
The majority of deaths occur through exhaustion during the attempt to swim against the current, which proves impossible.
If you get out of the current, swimming back is not more difficult than usual.
Try to get somewhere where you won't be caught again. Alternatively, if your skills are good enough and you haven't been spotted, you may have to wait for rescue.
The return shock comes earlier than the culture shock (the honeymoon phase is not so pronounced), lasts longer and can be more serious.

When you return home after an overseas stay, you have adapted to a different culture and dropped some of the habits of your home culture.
When you travel abroad for the first time, people are likely to be patient and understanding, because they know that travelers have to adapt to a new country.
Perhaps you don't expect that even returning travellers need patience and understanding.

The Japanese work culture is hierarchical and formal compared to what Westerners may be used to.
Suits are part of the standard business attire and colleagues address each other by their family names or job titles.
The harmony at the workplace is of great importance, with the focus more on group performance than on praise for individual performance.
Employees are often required to obtain the approval of their superiors for all decisions they make and they are expected to follow the instructions of their superiors without question.
